TravelTriangle > Blog > Chandigarh > 23 Hill Stations Near Chandigarh To Visit In 2025 23 Hill Stations Near Chandigarh To Visit In 2025 .. SHARES Updated Date: 28 February 2025 Chandigarh is undoubtedly the brimming epitome of urbanisation and metropolitan development in India. But it also provides as a getaway to the verdant hills of Himachal, Uttarakhand, and further north. Those seeking quick relief from their urban chores, city chaos, and stresses of work life have a range of splendid places near this beautiful city to check out. Need a break? Simply head out to any of the various blooming hill stations near Chandigarh that offer instant respite from life’s monotony and a truckload of adventure. You will have the time of your life at these beautiful hill stations in India. Table Of Content List of Hill Stations Near Chandigarh Within 100 Km Lying a stone’s throw away from Chandigarh, these offbeat hill stations near Chandigarh are ideal for a one-day trip. These are the shortlisted hilly areas near Chandigarh within 100 km: Nahan – Majestic Hill Town Parwanoo – Enjoy Cable Car Rides Morni Hills – Stunning Marvel Of Nature Barog – An Offbeat Hill Station Kasauli  – Old World Charm And Natural Beauty Solan – Paradise For Nature Lovers Nalagarh – Entryway To Himachal Pradesh 1. Nahan – Majestic Hill Town The capital of erstwhile Sirmur Princely State, Nahan is a small and majestic hill station in Himachal Pradesh. Surrounded by serene lakes and heritage temples, it reflects the prettiness of the hills. Nahan structured the second Municipal Corporation in India after Kolkata. It is one of the popular hilly places near Chandigarh to rejuvenate the mind and soul. Things to do in Nahan: Trekking, hiking Distance of Nahan from Chandigarh: 100 km Travel time: 3 hours Best Time To Visit: Apr-Sep Also Read: Places To Visit In Nahan 2. Parwanoo – Enjoy Cable Car Rides Parwanoo is among the nearest and among the best-unexplored hill stations near Chandigarh, India. A mere one-hour drive from Chandigarh, thanks to the newly built bypass road from Pinjore to Parwanoo, this place is famous for the Timber Trail and the cable car rides. Parwanoo is also known for its range of fruit products like jams, jellies, and marmalades, thanks to the vast fruit orchards of this place. It is considered one of the good hill stations near Chandigarh. Things to do in Parwanoo: Trekking, hiking, cable car rides Distance of Parwanoo from Chandigarh: 36 km Travel time: 1 hour Best Time To Visit: Mar-May, Oct-Nov Looking To Book A Holiday Package? Morni Hills – Stunning Marvel Of Nature The only hill station in Haryana, Morni Hill station near Chandigarh is a stunning marvel of nature located an hour’s drive from Chandigarh. This place is renowned for its two lakes, adding to this hill town’s beauty and diverse flora and fauna. It’s probably the best hill station near Chandigarh for those who want a quick trip to escape the scorching heat of the city in the summer, as well as refreshing views of quaint hills and mighty pine trees. This is among the best hill stations near Chandigarh, within 150 km. Things to do in Morni Hills: Boating, trekking, birdwatching, jungle walks Distance of Morni Hills from Chandigarh: 42 km Travel time: 1 hour 18 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year Related Post: 23 Picnic Spots Near Gurgaon (Updated & With Photos) 4. Barog – An Offbeat Hill Station Barog is another one among the offbeat hill stations nearby Chandigarh. Lying on the Chandigarh-Shimla route, Barog is located on the hilltop and provides stunning views of cloud-covered hills and lakes below. There are many hotels, resorts and places to visit in Barog. You can go trekking, go forest walks, etc. here. Set amid the mighty Himalayan ranges, the quiet hamlet of Barog provides as the perfect destination to escape the hustle and bustle of city life as well as the crowds of tourists lurking in popular hill stations close to Chandigarh. This is certainly amongst the best hill stations to visit near Chandigarh. Things to do in Barog: Karol Tibba trek, paragliding Distance of Barog from Chandigarh: 60 km Travel time: 2 hours Best Time To Visit: March to June and October to November 5. Kasauli – Old World Charm And Natural Beauty On the list of the small hill stations near Chandigarh to visit is Kasauli, located in the Solan district of Himachal and known for its old-world charm and natural beauty. The major attraction of the Kasauli hill station near Chandigarh is the Monkey Point, which overlooks forests of horse chestnut and Himalayan oak. Also, there is a small temple atop a hill, and the Gilbert Nature Trail is nearby, whose winding lanes and lush green countryside attract many birdwatchers to this paradise. Things to do in Kasauli: Trekking, jungle trails, birdwatching Distance of Kasauli from Chandigarh: 60 km Travel time: 2 hours Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year Related Post: Things To Do In Kasauli 6. Solan – Pardise For Nature Lovers Solan is an excellent choice for those looking for beautiful hill stations near Chandigarh for one day trip. Solan is located on the Punjab-Himachal Border, a low-key hill town on the lower ranges of the Himalayas. There are many places to visit in Solan. The city has ancient temples and beautiful monasteries that attract scores of tourists and devotees every year. The place is also a gem for nature lovers owing to its backdrop of majestic hills and quaint atmosphere. Solan also has one of the oldest breweries in the country. The 300-year-old fort on the hilltop here provides awe-inspiring panoramic views of the misty hills and is a great spot for travelers to chill. Things to do in Solan: Trekking, hiking Distance of Solan from Chandigarh: 67.5 km Travel time: 2 hours 20 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year 7. Nalagarh – Entryway To Himachal Pradesh The beautiful hill station, Nalagarh, is popular for its serenity. It is the entryway to Himachal Pradesh and is amongst the best hill stations near Chandigarh within 50 km. Nalagarh Fort is the main attraction in the hill town which has now been converted into a hotel. The hill station is also famous for activities like activities and fishing which you can enjoy at the Gobind Sagar Lake. Indeed one of the nearest hill stations from Chandigarh. Things to do in Nalagarh: Boating, fishing Distance of Nalagarh from Chandigarh: 48 km Travel time: 1 hour 30 minutes Best Time To Visit: October to March Related Post: Hotels In Nalagarh Hill Stations Near Chandigarh Within 300 Km Popular and fun, these hill places are the most lovable retreats near Chandigarh, packed with the most ethereal views and thrilling attractions. These are the shortlisted hill stations near Chandigarh within 300 km: Chail – For A Relaxing Vacation Shimla – The Queen Of Hills Kufri – A Picturesque Hill Station Dehradun – Winter Capital Of Uttarakhand Narkanda – Witness The Gorgeous Sunrise Mussoorie – Scenic Waterfalls And Capitvating Landscapes Dharamshala – Home To Great Dalai Lama Kullu – Panoramic Views And Majestic Hills Mcleodganj – Little Lhasa Kasol – Known As The Amsterdam Of India Kanatal – For Peace Seekers Shoghi – A Quaint Little Hill Station Mandi – Varanasi Of Hills 8. Chail – For A Relaxing Vacation A quiet and peaceful offbeat paradise or the nearest hill station from Chandigarh, Chail of Shimla is the location of the world’s highest cricket ground and the heritage hotel – Chail Palace. Surrounded by lush greenery, mesmerising views, and a dreamy expanse of pine and deodar trees, Chail never disappoints its visitors who search for nature and adventure. Once the summer capital of the Patiala Kings, this place is now the quintessential destination for travellers seeking a calm and relaxed vacation. It is one of the best hill stations around Chandigarh. Things to do in Chail: Hiking, wildlife spotting Distance of Chail from Chandigarh: 107 km Travel time: 3 hours 35 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year 9. Shimla – The Queen Of Hills Still looking for the best hill stations around Chandigarh? The favourite hill town of holidaymakers and the erstwhile summer retreat of Britishers, Shimla never fails to attract travellers with its unending beauty and charm. The colonial architecture, the hip vibe, the chic cafes, the bustling Mall Road markets, and the pretty attractions – all of them together make Shimla an irresistible escapade during summer. Undoubtedly the best hill station near Chandigarh, Shimla is the go-to place for youngsters and elders alike for a quick one day trip from the city. Things to do in Shimla: Camping, rafting, rock climbing, shopping Distance of Shimla from Chandigarh: 114 km Travel time: 3 hours 50 mins Best Time To Visit: March – June Related Post: Cafes In Shimla 10. Kufri – A Picturesque Hill Station Set in the Shimla district of Himachal, Kufri is one of the most sought-after holiday destinations in India for lovers of hills and nature. Its proximity to Shimla, its high altitude offering dreamy views of cloud-hugging mountains and snow-capped hills make it a preferred destination for all couples and honeymooners, especially in the winters. A relatively quiet retreat compared to Shimla, Kufri is the ideal substitute for the crowded hill stations near Chandigarh, which offer a range of exciting activities. It is one of the nearest hill stations to Chandigarh. Things to do in Kufri: Trekking, skiing, sledging Distance of Kufri from Chandigarh: 128 km Travel time: 4 hours 20 mins Best Time To Visit: Nov-Mar 11. Dehradun – Winter Capital Of Uttarakhand A charming hill town nestled in the foothills of the Shivalik ranges, Dehradun is a popular educational hub in India. But this capital of Uttarakhand has more to it than grand institutes and a Military Training College. Other than a host of verdant valleys, a couple of perennial streams, majestic sceneries, and temples, Dehradun has a laid-back atmosphere owing to the young population. Dehradun is considered one of the best hill stations close to Chandigarh owing to its array of popular tourist attractions to explore – Clock Tower, Chetwode Hall, Tapovan, Tapkeshwar Temple, and Robber’s Cave, to name a few. It is one of the best hill stations near Chandigarh within 200 kms. Things to do in Dehradun: Paragliding, skiing, river rafting, angling, trekking, picnicking Distance of Dehradun from Chandigarh: 166.5 km Travel time: 4 hours 30 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year Related Post: Restaurants In Dehradun  Planning your holiday but confused about where to go? Narkanda – Witness The Gorgeous Sunrise Narkanda is another nearest hill station to Chandigarh for those who wish to experience extreme winters and play with knee-deep snow. Located beyond Shimla and Kufri, Narkanda is a great place to witness the magic of sunrises and sunsets over the far-off mountain peaks covered in snow even in summers. Just as much fun in summers and in winters, Narkanda will never fail to surprise you with its astounding views, chilled out vibe, lush forests and apple orchards, Tannu Jabar Lake, popular attractions, and scores of activities. Things to do in Narkanda: Skiing, boating, trekking, jungle trails Distance of Narkanda from Chandigarh: 174 km Travel time: 5 hours 30 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year 13. Mussoorie – Scenic Waterfalls And Captivating Landscapes Perched atop a mountain valley in Uttarakhand, Mussoorie draws a great influx of travellers yearly with its awe-inspiring green hills, old-world colonial architecture, scenic waterfalls, blooming diversity of flora and fauna, and captivating landscapes. Providing the perfect escape from the unforgiving heat in the plains in summers and as a charming white wonderland in winters, Mussoorie is among the best hill stations near Chandigarh for one day trips. Things to do in Mussoorie: Ropeway rides, Sky Bridge, trekking, rafting, paragliding, shopping Distance of Mussoorie from Chandigarh: 196 km Travel time: 5 hours 30 mins Best Time To Visit: Sep-Jun Related Post: Honeymoon In Mussoorie 14. Dharamshala – Home To Great Dalai Lama Famed as the holy residence of the great Dalai Lama and the Tibetan monk in exile, Dharamshala and Mcleodganj are popular summer retreats for those who come to immerse themselves in the spiritual aura of this Tibetan hub. Located in the Kangra district of Himachal, Dharamshala houses numerous stunning monasteries and Buddhist cultural centers for a peek into this vivid culture, apart from offering picturesque views of the Dhauladhar ranges. It is one of the best hill places near Chandigarh to learn and explore Buddhism and the Tibetan culture. Things to do in Dharamshala: Triund trek, camping, paragliding, shopping Distance of Dharamshala from Chandigarh: 244 km Travel time: 5 hours 30 mins Best Time To Visit: February – June 15. Kullu – Panoramic Views And Majestic Hills Kullu is one of the best hill stations near Chandigarh that is generally coupled with Manali. Situated at an altitude of 1,230 meters, Kullu is an open valley that offers panoramic views of majestic hills covered with snow. The endless deodar and pine jungles, pristine streams, and wonderful climate also make it a nature lover’s paradise. While here, one can indulge in many adventure activities or explore popular attractions like Raghunath Temple, Jagannathi Devi Temple, Pandoh Dam, and Chandrakhani Pass. Things to do in Kullu: River rafting, trekking, mountaineering Distance of Kullu from Chandigarh: 266.5 km Travel time: 6 hours 40 mins Best Time To Visit: Oct-Jun Related Post: Places To Visit In Kullu 16. Mcleodganj – Little Lhasa Also known as Little Lhasa, Mcleodganj is a hill station visited frequently by many tourists. It is famous across the world for being home to the Dalai Lama. Popular among trekkers, you can enjoy the lush greenery and the stunning landscapes. While visiting this beautiful hill town, plan your visit to Dharamshala, Bhagsu Nag and Kangra as they are all located close to each other. Things to do in Mcleodganj: Trekking, enjoying gorgeous views Distance of Mcleodganj from Chandigarh: 240 km Travel time: 6 hours Best Time To Visit: March to June, September to November 17. Kasol – Known As The Amsterdam Of India Image Source: Alok Kumar for Wikimedia Commons Situated along the banks of the Parvati river in Himachal, Kasol is one of the best hill stations near Chandigarh and is slowly and steadily gaining fame amongst trekkers, nature lovers, and backpackers. Kasol is also known as the Amsterdam of India. It is a quaint little village that is known for its scenic beauty, beautiful mountains, and breathtaking views. It is one of the few places in India that are untouched by urbanization. Kasol is a place where you can relax in the lap of nature and feel all your worries fade away. The best way to spend some time in Kasol is to stroll next to the river and witness the snow-capped mountains in the background. Kasol, one of the nearest hill stations from Chandigarh, is known for its various trekking trails, including Kheerganga trek, Yanger Pass, Sar Pass, and Pin Parbati Pass. Things to do in Kasol: Trekking, Camping, Fishing, Try local cuisine Distance of Kasol from Chandigarh: 288 Kms Travel time: 7 hours 40 mins Best Time To Visit: October – June Related Post: Places To Visit In Kasol 18. Kanatal – For Peace Seekers Image Credit: Prakhartodaria for Wikimedia Commons Kanatal is one of the nearest hill stations to Chandigarh and is known amongst travellers looking for peace and solitude. The place is said to have derived its name from a lake that once existed here. The lush green forest, majestic hills, and beautiful orchards paint quite a picture, which is mesmerizing enough to keep you here apart from the many magnificent places to visit in Kanatal. Kanatal is a gateway to other major hill stations such as Dehradun, Chamba, and Mussoorie. Witness the untouched beauty and pleasant weather on your next trip to this hilly area near Chandigarh. Things to do in Kanatal: camping, trekking, sightseeing, jungle safari Distance of Kanatal from Chandigarh: 245 Kms Travel time: 6 hours 30 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year 19. Shoghi – A Quaint Little Hill Station Image Credit: Bikingdiaries for Wikimedia Commons Shoghi is a quaint little hill station near Shimla that is unexplored and retains its natural beauty. The place is an epitome of beauty in every sense; it is calm, serene, and untouched by urbanisation. It is one of the most magnificent hilly areas near Chandigarh. Shoghi is a natural habitat of many flora and fauna, making this place nothing short of a paradise. This small hill station offers a large number of things to do, from adventure activities to leisure activities. The best thing about Shoghi is the weather, which is amazing around the year and offers a relaxing environment for those seeking it. Things to do in Shoghi: Camping, trekking, shopping, dining Distance of Shoghi from Chandigarh: 101 Kms Travel time: 2 hours 45 mins Best Time To Visit: Oct-Jun Related Post: Hotels In Shoghi  20. Mandi – Varanasi Of Hills Image Credit: Ajaz Tantray for Wikimedia Commons Mandi is located at the junction of Dharamshala and Kullu, a small town known for its scenic beauty, lush green forests, and majestic mountains. The town is laden with approximately 82 temples, and the name Choti Kashi was acquired. It is also known as the ‘Varanasi of hills’. Mandi lies on the banks of River Beas, offering solitude, a peaceful environment, and a lot of places of worship, some of which are as old as the 5th Century AD. Mandi is the gateway to Kullu, Manali, Spiti and Lahaul and to some of the most popular treks such as Prashar lake and Janjheli trek. Things to do in Mandi: Temple hopping, trekking, camping, wildlife safari Distance of Mandi from Chandigarh: 184 Kms Travel time: 4 hours 50 mins Best Time To Visit: Apr-Oct Hill Stations Near Chandigarh Beyond 300 Km Check out these beautiful hill stations near Chandigarh beyond 300 km for your amazing vacation. Lansdowne – A Quaint Hill Town Manali – Adventure Capital Dalhousie – A Piece Of Paradise 21. Lansdowne – A Quaint Hill Town Image Credit: Ravi Krishnan Gupta for Wikimedia Commons Located in Uttarakhand in the Pauri district, Lansdowne is one of the many hilly areas near Chandigarh, which is nothing short of a paradise. The place houses buildings that depict the architecture of the colonial era. This is a popular hill station amongst people who love nature, peace, and bird watching. The town gets its name from Lord Lansdowne – Viceroy of India during British rule. The hotels, guesthouses, and almost every building in this town are a constant reminder of the colonial era and are built in a manner that offers amazing views of the mountains. Things to do in Lansdowne: Boat ride, camping, trekking, birdwatching, shopping Distance of Lansdowne from Chandigarh: 307 Kms Travel time: 7 hours 25 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year Related Post: Places To Visit In Lansdowne 22. Manali – Adventure Capital Image Credit: Neerajsinghazm for Wikimedia Commons Manali is among the most fun hill stations near Chandigarh, apart from being the most beautiful as well. Manali is a valley in the Kullu district of Himachal that overwhelms travelers by flowering apple trees and adventurous snow-covered terrains. It’s the world’s favourite hill destination in India, which gives it much of its hipster vibe, laid-back atmosphere, and scores of chic cafes offering foreign cuisines to the armies of international visitors it receives every year. Other than amazing landscapes studded with pristine rivers, woods, and snow-capped Himalayas, Manali also houses the adventure capitals of the country – Rohtang Pass and Solang Valley. Things to do in Manali: Trekking, paragliding, skiing, zorbing, white water rafting Distance of Manali from Chandigarh: 307 km Travel time: 8 hours Best Time To Visit: October – June 23. Dalhousie – A Piece Of Paradise Image Credit: Piyush Tripathi for Wikimedia Commons A tiny tinsel town tucked away in the lap of nature, Dalhousie is truly a piece of paradise. Replete with rustic colonial architecture, dreamy snow-clad mountains, pine-clad valleys, flowery meadows, ferocious rivers, and picturesque rice terraces, Dalhousie is the go-to destination for those looking for rejuvenating hill stations near Chandigarh to enliven their souls. One of the best places to visit in Dalhousie is Khajjiar. Rightly known as the Mini Switzerland of India, Khajjiar is a deep green grassland surrounded by pine trees and brilliant views. It’s the ultimate destination for adventure and picnicking for families with kids, couples, and thrill-seekers alike. Things to do in Dalhousie: Trekking, river crossing, paragliding, zorbing, wildlife sighting, flying fox Distance of Dalhousie from Chandigarh: 311 km Travel time: 6 hours 50 mins Best Time To Visit: Throughout the year You May Also Like To Read: Places To Visit In Dalhousie Conclusion Had your fill? Although there are many hill stations near Chandigarh, but Solan, Barog, Chail, Mashobra, and Morni Hills are some of the unexplored hill stations around Chandigarh. Is Parwanoo a hill station? Yes, Parwanoo is a scenic hill station in Himachal Pradesh known for its green environs and orchards. Plan a trip to this breezy hill station with your travel buddies and enjoy the serene beauty of this breathtaking place. Which are the romantic hill stations near Chandigarh? Manali, Dalhousie, Dharamshala, Kufri, Mussoorie, and Shimla are some of the best romantic hill places near Chandigarh for couples and honeymooners. How can I go to Kasauli from Chandigarh? Kasauli is around 58 km away from Chandigarh, and the best way to reach here is by hiring a taxi. There are no direct trains or buses to reach Kasauli from here. Is Kasol and Kasauli same? No, Kasol and Kasauli are two different places in Himachal Pradesh. Kasauli is at a close distance of around 58 km while Kasol is an overnight journey of around 8.5 hours with a distance of around 270 km from Chandigarh. Where can I find snow near Chandigarh? Some of the places where one can find snow near Chandigarh in late December or January are:1. Shimla (113 km from Chandigarh) 2. Mussoorie (204 km from Chandigarh) 3. Manali (290 km from Chandigarh) How far is Lansdowne from Chandigarh? Lansdowne is at a distance of around 307 km from Chandigarh. One should travel via bus, taxi to this place.
